item.description: What Bitcoin Core says: "there are many important stakeholders in the ecosystem" What Core does: hosts 2nd private event for only miners

item.title: Bitcoin Miners and Developers Meet in California to
item.description:
Bitcoin Miners and Developers Meet in California to

What was thought by some to be a secret meeting of Bitcoin miners and Bitcoin Core developers turned out to look more like a company retreat than anything else, according to those in attendance.

item.title: Satoshi Forest Homeless Outreach Program Threatened by Judge
item.description:
Satoshi Forest Homeless Outreach Program Threatened by Judge

Bitcoin.com Also read: 'Decentralized Uber' App Delivers 1,000 Meals in Austin, Texas recently spoke with Michael Kimberl of Sean's Outpost concerning an upcoming threat against the Satoshi Forest sanctuary's livelihood by neighboring property owners and Escambia County officials.

item.title: Exclusive: LexisNexis and start-up join to curb bitcoin money-laundering
item.description:
Exclusive: LexisNexis and start-up join to curb bitcoin money-laundering

LONDON A company that provides banks with anti-money-laundering controls has teamed up with a bitcoin security firm to try to curb nefarious uses of the digital currency, such as drug trafficking and terrorism financing.

item.title: Bitfinex Security Breach: Platform Suspends Trade and Confirms BTC Theft
item.description:
Bitfinex Security Breach: Platform Suspends Trade and Confirms BTC Theft

Bitfinex suspends trade after discovering a security breach. Confirms loss of bitcoin, exact figures awaited. Bitfinex, one of the leading digital currency exchange, today reported that it has faced a security breach. Following the discovery, the exchange reportedly halted all its bitcoin trading operations until further notice.

item.title: Bitcoin Smart Contract 'Federation' to Launch With 25 Startups - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Smart Contract 'Federation' to Launch With 25 Startups - CoinDesk

Bitcoin smart contracts are getting their own cooperative. Announced today, a group of international bitcoin companies have signed a letter of intent to form a federation that would find them supporting and contributing to the development of a smart contracts platform that would run with the support of the bitcoin blockchain.

item.title: Bitfinex Offline as Customer Bitcoin Reported Stolen - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitfinex Offline as Customer Bitcoin Reported Stolen - CoinDesk

Hong Kong digital currency exchange Bitfinex has taken its trading platform offline following a reported hack that resulted in the theft of customer funds. According to a statement posted on its website, Bitfinex has suspended trading, deposits and withdrawals. Both the number of customers impacted or the exact amount lost in the breach are unclear at this time.

item.title: Exclusive: LexisNexis and start-up join to curb bitcoin money-laundering
item.description:
Exclusive: LexisNexis and start-up join to curb bitcoin money-laundering

LONDON A company that provides banks with anti-money-laundering controls has teamed up with a bitcoin security firm to try to curb nefarious uses of the digital currency, such as drug trafficking and terrorism financing.

item.title: Bitcoin to Hardfork? Proposal Sees Grassroots Beginnings
item.description:
Bitcoin to Hardfork? Proposal Sees Grassroots Beginnings

After a year and a half of debate with no compromise reached, supporters of on-chain scaling, have, seemingly, decided to unilaterally hardfork. A new subreddit, r/btcfork, was announced earlier today, quickly gaining attention and momentum with numerous threads published in just hours after the announcement was made and many bitcoiners joining in the lively debate.

item.title: Indacoin: Buying Bitcoin, Litecoin with a Credit Card
item.description:
Indacoin: Buying Bitcoin, Litecoin with a Credit Card

Indacoin is an exchange service that allows users to buy bitcoin and litecoin with debit or credit cards. With customers across the world, in areas such as the US, Canada, Europe and the CIS region, this platform aims to make bitcoin more accessible to the average person.
